author: Five Binaries
title: Localize Yoroi for Slovak market
description: Yoroi is missing Slovak localization making it difficult to use on the local market.

assessments.note:
The proposal is clear and has a proper overview for the whole project lifecycle. It is beneficial to have as many language adaptations. The cost noted are clear, one time cost for translation and 1 year maintenance.
The only question arises, what happens after the yearly maintenance passes?
Might be worth of dedicating some cost for a longer time maintenance.

This proposal is listed under "Developer ecosystem" but it seems like it would be better suited to address the challenge in "Dapps and Integrations".  However, it would still be helpful to Slovak developers.
Whilst this may be an useful project for Cardano, it is focused on users, not developers and thus does not meet the challenge.
assessments.reply: The challenge focus includes "... A wide variety of resources are provided for developers allowing them to focus on business value they can generate and not on infrastructure ..." and we feel this is the case too. If the Yoroi wallet is translated and it provides an interaction frontend to the end user, the developer does not need to care about compliance and can focus on developing its project.

assessments.note:
Apart from targeting a new language, in a neighbouring jurisdiction, this proposal is effectively an identical proposal to https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Localize-Yoroi-for-Czech-market/352236-48088 , which in this case is not a bad thing, as it will further expand the Cardano ecosystem by the same rationale as that one. The proposal is not strictly related to the experience of the developers but would improve the experience of all users in a given region. Thus it could increase the number of developers actively building on top of Cardano.
As identified in the proposal it could also help with regulatory procedures in Slovakia, by helping Yoroi comfort to EU norms. This could also lead to an improved developer ecosystem.

In this proposal you state: "Many jurisdictions, mostly on European markets, have consumer protection laws that make it difficult to introduce an application without a localized interface.". 
If this is the case, then many dApps would be hard to introduce and maintain on these markets without some bigger type of coordination. An example of a restrictive law or condition would increase the credibility of this proposal. 
Could this proposal be more generalized and valid for all languages that need to be translated? A community driven platform for translations or something similar? The community seems happy to help in this aspect according to the comments.
It is hard to identifying a clear connection between this proposal and the key metrics given the 'Developer Ecosystem' campaign brief. Can you try to clarify this further in your proposal?
This proposal offers a year worth of support for localizing a specific market, it is unclear if this really is considered impactful given this particular campaign. 
I will rate this a (2) in terms of impact with the current information available. 
Note that this assessment is posted in the 'Localize Yoroi for Slovak market' and '...for Czech market' since both proposals are very similar.
With the assurance that  Emurgo has outsourced the efforts, it is always preferable to have multilanguage support in the primary mobile Cardano wallet.

The problem and solution description is reasonable and objective. Yoroi's location is an important implementation, but that implementation is more in line with the Dapps & Integrations challenge, so I recommend submitting the proposal there.

I am submitting the same assessment for two proposals, as they are similar, the only change is the language to be translated.
Experience is clear, maybe additionally some details about translation and its review/verification flow would be useful. The targeted goals can be reached in the given time.

The proposer gives a clear budget for about 17,000 words including upkeep and provides a firm timeline for completing the localization. They mention that they deal with localizations for some other projects. Yoroi wallet is a product developed by Emurgo; they are not mentioned in the proposal besides being customers. Does Emurgo contract out for localizations? It is not clear how this relationship works.

Given that this is practically the same proposal as https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Localize-Yoroi-for-Czech-market/352236-48088 , but for a different region the same arguments stand. Given the experience of the team and the fact that it's a very straight forward task I see no real obstacle that would prevent this proposal from being successfully implemented. The budget is also extremely sensible and an explanation is provided for the amount requested.

The proposer presents clear evidence of prior related work and experience within the field. The type of work this proposal addresses is not considered very complex, which makes this proposal likely to be successful if it were to be funded. 
The budget is clearly outlined and the references of the proposer are very strong. In terms of feasibility, this proposal achieves a (5). It is likely, with the information given, to be implemented if funded. 
Note that this assessment is posted in the 'Localize Yoroi for Slovak market' and '...for Czech market' since both proposals are very similar.
Proposal has established credentials in development and the proposal is simple therefore it can be reliably stated that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

The proposer described relevant experiences for this proposal, indicating the ability to successfully implement the proposal.

There is a reasonable budget breakdown.

The plan is simple and concise, it describes enough for a proposal of low complexity.

I am submitting the same assessment for two proposals, as they are similar, the only change is the language to be translated.
The proposal is clearly auditable, worth of checking what other languages could be supported once the project infrastructure is setup.

The proposer mentions the issues a developer might have when attempting to distribute an application that is not localized in some European markets; if the app relies on Yoroi Wallet then being localized for the target market would be beneficial for the developer as well

This would be an extremely easy proposal to audit, either the translation would be completed or it wouldn't. It really wouldn't leave much gray area in that regard. 
Note: The same proposal as https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Localize-Yoroi-for-Czech-market/352236-48088 , but for a different region.

This proposal promises localization for a smaller specific market during a year for 2500 dollars worth of compensation. The proposer does not mention any obligations or promises to uphold the translations within a reasonable timeframe after new updates. Provide details about your obligations in terms of deadlines in order to increase the credibility of the proposal overall.

In a perfect world, all apps and platforms would be available in every language. It all comes down to ROI in this case. You ask for 2500 dollars worth of funding for this proposal (Slovak market) as well as for the Czech market, that is 5000 dollars worth of funding in total. 
Will 5000 dollars worth of ADA to these two proposals contribute to more ROI to the community then other proposals in this campaign? It is hard to judge if this proposal is impactful given the funding. In terms of auditability, the proposal seems plausible. Since the proposal is hard to assess I will take a neutral standing an give this proposal a rating of (3).

I recommend the inclusion of metrics / KPIs so that we can measure the impact of the proposal on the challenge.

solution: Provide Yoroi with a localized Slovak interface. This needs to be up to date with each new Yoroi update and coordinated with translators.
experience: We have been working on localization and translation of Signal Private Messenger, Fedora Project operating system or Secure Drop.
